filters.title: american revolution and its era: maps and charts of north america and the west indies, 1750-1789

description: Shows rural householders' names. LC Maps of North America, 1750-1789, no. 1500 Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings. "Publish'd according to Act of Parliament, May the 1st, 1770, by S. Hooper, No. 25 Ludgate Hill, London." "To His most Excellent Majesty George the IIId ... this map is most humbly dedicated by ... John Collet." Includes royal coat of arms. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Vault LC has 2 copies. Coloration differs. Negative photocopy of copy 1 filed with maps.

medium: 1 map : hand col., mounted on cloth backing ; 70 x 107 cm.
notes: LC Maps of North America, 1750-1789, no. 1500
Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings.
"Publish'd according to Act of Parliament, May the 1st, 1770, by S. Hooper, No. 25 Ludgate Hill, London."
"To His most Excellent Majesty George the IIId ... this map is most humbly dedicated by ... John Collet."

LC has 2 copies. Coloration differs. Negative photocopy of copy 1 filed with maps.

description: Pen-and-ink and water color on tracing linen. Accompanied by letter of transmittal to Superintendent of the Coast and Geodetic Survey, dated October 30, 1883 ; in envelope 31 x 23 cm "Copied Office of the Light House Board October 30th 1883." In red in on map and letter: M. Section VI. 60a. Stamped in red: U.S.C. & G. Survey, Library and Archives Mar 12 1902, acc. no. 917. Stamped in blue at bottom right: Coast & Geodetic Survey Office, Drawing Division Nov 5 1883." Includes field notes. Annotated on verso: May 24th 1883 acted on and adopted. LC copy imperfect: annotated and slightly stained. In ink on blue bordered label, 872 1883. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

notes: Pen-and-ink and water color on tracing linen.
Accompanied by letter of transmittal to Superintendent of the Coast and Geodetic Survey, dated October 30, 1883 ; in envelope 31 x 23 cm
"Copied Office of the Light House Board October 30th 1883."
In red in on map and letter: M. Section VI. 60a.
Stamped in red: U.S.C. & G. Survey, Library and Archives Mar 12 1902, acc. no. 917.
Stamped in blue at bottom right: Coast & Geodetic Survey Office, Drawing Division Nov 5 1883."
Annotated on verso: May 24th 1883 acted on and adopted.
LC copy imperfect: annotated and slightly stained. In ink on blue bordered label, 872 1883.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: Scale ca. 1:32,000. Relief shown by hachures. Prime meridian: Ferro. "To Sir William Young, Bart. ... this plan of the island of St. Vincent ... John Byres." Shows land granted to the Caribs, treaty boundaries, and boundaries of salable lands. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes explanatory text. Vault AACR2

location: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines--Saint Vincent
notes: "To Sir William Young, Bart. ... this plan of the island of St. Vincent ... John Byres."

description: Relief shown by contours. "To George Etherington Esqr. Lieutenant Colonel, in the 60th. or Royal American Regiment of Foot; This Plan of the Bequia is most respectfully Inscribed By His greatly Obliged, and most Humble Servant, John Byres." Includes text and indexed table of names of claimants as well as unclaimed land. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
